You can also send the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor/usingColorSpace(_:)] message to an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor] object to convert it between two color spaces, either of which may be a custom color space.

# NSColorSpace

**Class**

An object that represents a custom color space.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSColorSpace
```

## Overview

You can make custom color spaces from ColorSync profiles or from ICC profiles. [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpace] also has factory methods that return objects representing the system color spaces.

You can use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor/init(colorSpace:components:count:)] method of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor] class to create color objects using custom [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpace] objects. You can also send the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor/usingColorSpace(_:)] message to an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor] object to convert it between two color spaces, either of which may be a custom color space.

## Getting a Named Color Space

- **deviceRGB**: A color space object that represents a calibrated or device-dependent RGB color space.
- **genericRGB**: A color space object that represents a device-independent RGB color space.
- **deviceCMYK**: A color space object that represents a calibrated or device-dependent CMYK color space.
- **genericCMYK**: A color space object that represents a device-independent CMYK color space.
- **deviceGray**: A color space object that represents a calibrated or device-dependent gray color space.
- **genericGray**: A color space object that represents a device-independent gray color space.
- **sRGB**: A color space object that represents an sRGB color space.
- **extendedSRGB**: A color space object that represents an extended sRGB color space.
- **displayP3**: A color space object that represents a P3 Display color space.
- **genericGamma22Gray**: A color space object that represents a gray color space with a gamma value of 2.2.
- **extendedGenericGamma22Gray**: A color space object that represents an extended gray color space with a gamma value of 2.2.
- **adobeRGB1998**: A color space object that represents an Adobe RGB (1998) color space.

## Getting the Color Spaces Available On the System

- **availableColorSpaces(with:)**: Returns the list of color spaces available on the system that are displayed in the color panel, in the order they are displayed in the color panel.

## Initializing a Custom Color Space Object

- **init(cgColorSpace:)**: Initializes and returns a color space object initialized from a Core Graphics color-space object.
- **init(colorSyncProfile:)**: Initializes and returns a color space object from the specified ColorSync profile.
- **init(iccProfileData:)**: Initializes and returns a color space object from the specified ICC profile.

## Accessing Color Space Data and Attributes

- **cgColorSpace**: The Core Graphics color-space object that represents a color space equivalent to the color space’s.
- **colorSpaceModel**: The model on which the color space is based.
- **NSColorSpace.Model**: Constants that describe the abstract model on which color space objects are based.
- **colorSyncProfile**: The ColorSync profile from which the color space was created.
- **iccProfileData**: The ICC profile data from which the color space was created.
- **localizedName**: The localized name of the color space.
- **numberOfColorComponents**: The number of components, excluding alpha, the color space supports.

## Colors

- **NSColor**: An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity (alpha value).
- **NSColorList**: An ordered list of color objects, identified by keys.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
